intro: Oxyspora paniculata var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences that bear small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
